intro: Didymoplexiella cinnabarina, commonly known as the red-stemmed didymoplexiella, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, reddish stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and somewhat endangered species.
